intro.title: Intro to Ruby
intro.description: Welcome to Ruby. Learn the language fundamentals, and how it differs from your current language of choice.

variables-and-constants.title: Variables and Constants
variables-and-constants.description: Ruby takes a relaxed attitude to data storage. Variables and constants.

numbers.title: Integers and Floats
numbers.description: Numbers are objects in Ruby and can be treated as such.

strings.title: Strings
strings.description: Ruby has an unusually rich string manipulation API.

flow-control.title: Flow Control
flow-control.description: Ruby loves it when you tell it what to do.

blocks.title: Blocks
blocks.description: Blocks are inline functions. We use them everywhere in Ruby. Learn what they are and how they work.

rspec.title: RSpec
rspec.description: Testing is a big deal in Ruby. RSpec is your premier tool for the job.

arrays.title: Arrays
arrays.description: We can accomplish many tasks using Array manipulation

hashes-and-symbols.title: Hashes and Symbols
hashes-and-symbols.description: Symbols are lightweight placeholder strings. Learn what they are useful for.

classes-and-objects.title: Classes and Objects
classes-and-objects.description: Everything in Ruby is an object. Learn Object orientation.

monkey-patching.title: Monkey Patching
monkey-patching.description: All objects are open and can be modified and extended.

operator-overloading.title: Operator Overloading
operator-overloading.description: Most language constructs in Ruby are in fact functions and can be overridden.

inheritance.title: Inheritance
inheritance.description: Inheritance allows a class to inherit values from it's parent. Ruby of course has it.

static-methods.title: Static Methods
static-methods.description: Ruby's simple object model doesn't support Static methods directly, instead we get Eigenclasses, which are better.

modules.title: Modules
modules.description: Separate your code into sensible modules for code reuse and modularity.

extend-and-include.title: Include vs Extend
extend-and-include.description: When to extend modules, and when to include them

receiving-a-block.title: Writing Methods which Receive Blocks
receiving-a-block.description: We can pass blocks to functions.

introspection.title: Introspection
introspection.description: Look inside running Ruby objects and find out what they do. The gateway to meta-programming.

writing-a-gem.title: Writing a Gem
writing-a-gem.description: We can ball our code up into a gem to make it easy to share.

method-missing.title: Method Missing
method-missing.description: Create adaptive objects by defining methods on the fly

instance-eval.title: Instance Eval
instance-eval.description: Create a Domain Specific Language using instance eval.

lifecycle-callbacks.title: Lifecycle Callbacks
lifecycle-callbacks.description: Call functions automatically when objects come into existence.

hello-world.title: Hello World
hello-world.description: Every project starts with a hello world

layouts-and-partials.title: Layouts and Partials
layouts-and-partials.description: Breaking your views out into sensible pieces

models.title: Models and Talking to the Database

scaffolding.title: Scaffolding and CRUD
scaffolding.code: Doing a lot of boilerplate stuff very quickly.

sessions.title: The Session Hash
sessions.description: Persisting session data has never been so much fun.

assets.title: Assets
assets.code: The Asset Pipeline is a powerful thing
